comments.commentBody:
And your winner is .... Scott Brooks.

Same players, that much improvement year over year?

No brainer.

Hmmmm.... Inasmuch as this "case" was developed nine months ago, the timing is odd, damned odd. Perhaps the staff forgot to tell Obama what was going on. It is also odd, damned odd, that with Mary Shapiro at the helm, the vote was reported as "along party lines".

The left on this site have unanimously found Goldman guilty. Before the case has been tried. What
about that little quirk in our legal system refered to as presumtion of innocence? Or does that not apply to non lefties?

So Goldman has volunteered to be the sacraficial lamb on the altar of Obama's villanizing of Wall Street. They still have 15 or so expats working in high places for Obama. Along the way, they will get every penny paid in fines back with interest.

In politics there are no coincidences, only cold calculation.

"Less educated Americans and senior citizens are also more likely to think (that Obama was born outside of the US) so than younger or better educated respondents." And that is FOX "news' " prime audience, those with pea-sized brains and the senile!
I know Obama was born in Hawaii, I was there at the birth.

Sigma:

OK, let's move on beyond the DGU issue.

"that Columbine or Virgina Tech would not have occurred had there been armed individuals on campus. There is no data to support this; as a matter of fact, armed persons did not prevent Fort Hood. There are no reliable stats on stolen guns being used in crimes; nor are the reliable stats on innocent lives saved versus taken by well-meaning gun carriers."

Item 1. There are data to support the proposition that mass murders can be stopped by armed victims. Bear in mind that when a mass murder occurs, it ends when one of three things happen 1) The shooter runs out of ammo (rare); 2) The shooter kills himself after he runs out of victims or gets tired (common); 3) Runs afoul of another person with a gun (occasional; a consummation devoutly to be wished). Only number 3 has the possibility of ameliorating damage. Notice that in "gun-free" zones (AKA "victim disarmament" zones), number 3 happens late, if ever. That is why mass murders happen in these zones -- they end only when the maniac decides to stop.

In contrast, there have been several well known abortions of aspiring mass murders, to wit Pearl High School, Appalachia State Law School, the Utah church, Tolley Square Shopping Center, wherein armed individuals brought a quick halt to the slaughter. In none of these cases was there any "collateral damage". Admittedly, the number of defenses is low but they are spectacularly successful. The experience with "gun-free zones" is uniformly dismal -- once a mass murderer starts doing business in one of those, he gets to finish pretty much as he will.

Item 2. Fort Hood was a victim disarmament zone -- THE SOLDIERS WERE NOT ARMED! This is excellent evidence for MY point. Only police were armed, and the murderer had his will with a room full of victims until condition 3 above happened -- the arrival with the persons with the guns. Had the victims been armed, as they SHOULD have been and as they were trained to be, the murderer would have been felled within seconds.

Item 3. Stolen guns being used in crime. Not sure why this is important. Guns used in crimes come from many sources, the most prominent pool being the criminal community. Most crime guns are either bought off the street from illegal sources (39.2%) or through family members or friends (39.6%), from Firearm use by Offenders, Bureau of Justice Statistics, November 2001.

Item 4. "reliable stats on innocent lives saved versus taken by well-meaning gun carriers." I tend to agree. But we do know that there is no massacre of innocent lives by well-meaning owners. From Gunfacts: 11% of police shootings kill an innocent person - about 2% of shootings by citizens
kill an innocent person, from Shall issue: the new wave of concealed handgun permit laws, Clayton Cramer, David Kopel, Independence Institute Issue Paper. October 17, 1994

As for discussing politics with open carriers, well I do it all the time (on ranges, where it is legal in TX). Other than that, I am not fond of open carry for many reasons...I prefer concealed.

Obama embodies the saying that "you can tell a lie as long as you believe it." He received the bulk of his donations from bundlers, not from small donors.

Of course, he won't return that million from Goldman Sachs or the hefty donations from the other Wall Street firms. He's the president so he's privileged to have his cake and eat it too.

To Jill #166
Sigh. So much misinformation, presented with absolute certainty.
So...FYI, parties with "tangible interest" can have access to tge vault certificate. Here is a list of parties considered by the Hawaiian DOH to have tangible interest:

Who is Eligible to Apply for Certified Copies of Vital Records?

A certified copy of a vital record (birth, death, marriage, or divorce certificate) is issued only to an applicant who has a direct and tangible interest in the record. The following persons are considered to have such an interest:

the registrant (the person whom the record is concerned with);
the registrant’s spouse;
the registrant’s parent(s);
a descendant of the registrant (e.g., a child or grandchild);
a person having a common ancestor with the registrant (e.g., a sibling, grandparent, aunt/uncle, or cousin);
a legal guardian of the registrant;
a person or agency acting on behalf of the registrant;
a personal representative of the registrant’s estate;
a person whose right to obtain a copy of the record is established by an order of a court of competent jurisdiction;
adoptive parents who have filed a petition for adoption and need to determine the death of one or more of the prospective adopted child’s natural or legal parents;
a person who needs to determine the marital status of a former spouse in order to determine the payment of alimony;
a person who needs to determine the death of a nonrelated co-owner of property purchased under a joint tenancy agreement; and
a person who needs a death certificate for the determination of payments under a credit insurance policy.

If the Democrats were really concerned about the working people as they purport to be, they would get some serious job initiatives on the table. That stimulus bill is a crock, failing to hold unemployment at 8% and to "create or save" 3 to 4 million jobs. And then they passed health legislation that will increase taxes and insurance premiums but do nothing to lower the cost of health care. Way to go Democrats!

Those who claim that the President has yet to prove he was born in the United States are missing a crucial point.

Fact of the matter is, if you are raising the argument, it is incumbent upon you to prove that he was born elsewhere. Until, you can do that, you will continue to be maligned as racists.

The ball's in your court. Prove your argument, or stop the whining.

I read only a sampling of comments on this article; I don't believe any of them got to the real answer to the misinformation about President Obama's birth. At least one comment alluded to the problem: the press. The New York Times and CBS; two major players in the nation's media did a poll and reported again that a large percentage of respondents - birthers - don't believe President Obama is a U.S. citizen. The media has been producing a lot of ink and air-time saying the same thing over and over and over again. I know, you started the article off with the facts, but then you go back to reporting all the same misinformation. The press and the Republican Party know - they know - President Obama is a U.S. citizen; both should be ashamed to continue the publishing/airing the lies and not speak out forcefully in stating President Obama is a U.S. citizen. You know there is no way he could have become a candidate and been elected President if he were not a citizen; the world of investigative reporting from the Times to the Enquirer would have been all over the story in 2007!

Interesting theory from the White House.  Less than an hour after after the SEC's announcement, if you Googled "SEC" and "Goldman Sachs" the first link in the directory was paid-for link taking you to the White House page on financial reform.

News Flash: "....Republicans have threatened to block the bill, but Democrats said they planned to push ahead."

If it weren't so odious, it would just be laughable. Kudos to Sen. Grassley.
Whatever his motive is, just breaking ranks is a good move.
He's been in a head lock long enough.

Now if Scott Brown can just break free and be his own man, we might get somewhere. He really has a chance to distinguish himself in history, if he only knew it.

I made a mistake on this one.  I thought he should start - but after seeing him in the postseason last year and so far this year, I think he should absolutely close. I think the key is mindset.  Joba likes to come in and let rip.  He likes the pressure.  When he starts a game, you can just see that he isn't into it in the same way as when he comes into a pressure situation.  Joba is actually the polar opposite to Mariano - fiery instead of cool.  But he's pretty dang effective, too. I think he's where he belongs.

I never knew that elected officials ( Tancredo, Bachman, Palin and others) can continue to show such venomous hate and disrespect for their Democratically elected President. Don't these trolls realize they have work to do FOR the People that elected them, instead they continue to fight( in futility) in the schoolyard. They are NOT patriotic Americans. As for the Birthers, their ignorance is beyond anyone's comprehension.
Voltaire: "Those who believe in absurdities are capable of atrocities"

When a Goldman lobbyist is quoted as saying that Goldman is "in favor" of more regulation, you have to know that this latest push is all show with no teeth. New administration is the same as the previous administrations. The strings of the Obama administration are being pulled by the money giants. Obama's anger is feigned.
I'm SOLD, Mr. President!  Go get 'em!
Many posters are eager to have a tougher regulation. I would wait till the open debate in the senate and house to see if it is tough enough too many voices/noise to see through all this.

This President deserves the praise of the country. Our economy has not fallen off a cliff. We have health care reform, we are respected again in the world, and we are now in the process of regulating the banks. History will tell the story of this leader. President Obama will rise to the top. And we need to remember this was done without one Republican.
I will never vote for a republican again. They are the non- legislators just collecting their paychecks, and they are of course well covered for health insurance. The party of no lead by the Faux News entertainers and Sarah Palin. I can think of nothing more pathetic.

I have the panasonic underwater camera and I used it in the galapagos. It was the BEST! especailly the video. It turned snorkeling into an art form. Could not have been happier. thank you for your review and confirming that I did the right thing by shelling out the money for this excellent, lightweight camera. Please also note that the out-of-water pics were excellent as well. i am very happy with it.

the problem with underwater digital cameras is that, after you've tried it, digital video is not that expensive anymore either! Plus, if you work underwater and it's clear, then leave your camera topside or you'll never get any work done!!!!

I tried 35mm and housings in the mid-1970s and hated the extra weight that the camera needed to get under, then the expense of film + development. The new generation is a little thing that I clip on my gear and let float up under my arm. When I'm working and something comes along that I haven't seen very often, I can take hundreds of shots and never think twice, except perhaps the time I'll spend editing, but that is at least at leisure.
Kodak play sport camera is good to 3 meters and has HD quality. Costs about $150. Very rugged camera and size is awesome.

Pentax has been in this game for some time with their Optio W series waterproof camera.  The current W-90 does great stills and shoots 720p video.  I use my older W-10 to cover sailing regattas while working as crew, and they're incredibly durable and capable.

I got off to a rip-roaring start with PASSE at 1A and SITARS at 3D.

JOHNNY ONX and SEX DRIVE were pretty inescapable, so one was simply forced to rattle ideas around in one's head until the truth dimly showed through. With that out of the way, the rest of the fill was mostly fun, then I had to return to the NW to tear down that misshapen mess and start all over again. Oh well, at least it was a win.

I'm surprised no one else has anything nasty to say about the new "Report as Inappropriate" invitation. It makes my teeth hurt.

really love to drive to sta rosa and eat at
IK ETZNAB mayan inspired cuisine , many stairs up in a simple classy environment with nouvelle cuisine.

God forgive me, but Obama is not telling the truth. He does not lie very well. we have caught on to his little filthy game.

What foolishness that the Democrats put out; year after year. . "We're for the people......." Democrats are the greatest filthy rich. slime they accuse others of being.These guys wrote the book on slime.

“………….On taxes, Mr. Obama gave no ground in his determination to let the tax cuts passed by his predecessor, George W. Bush, expire for the richest Americans despite concerns that raising taxes could hurt the tenuous economic recovery. “For us to extend them would mean hundreds of billions of dollars of lost revenue at a time when everybody says we’ve got to make sure that we’re dealing with our deficit,” he said.”

The amount of money lost over the last decade alone due to these cuts
is astronomical. No more cuts for those that have profited on perpetration.

“……….He acknowledged that the deficit has grown far more than he had expected until late in his presidential campaign and he seemed to leave the door open to new or increased taxes that would affect the middle class, despite his promise not to raise taxes on those making less than $250,000 a year.”

NO. NO. A promise is a promise. No more burden on those who are already reeling. Tax the banks and their evil sisters, who brought the country to its knees proportionate to the suffering they have caused. Without consequences like that, they will simply retire
to the back room to plan their next predatory assault.

“………Noting that his stimulus package last year gave temporary tax breaks to all but the wealthiest taxpayers, he reaffirmed his desire to avoid more taxes on the middle class. But he did not flatly rule them out, saying he would not prejudge the recommendations of a new commission he has appointed to develop ways to reduce the deficit.”

RULE THEM OUT! The President should not back pedal on these commitments.
Recommendations of the new ‘commission’ do not rule out favoritism to those whose constituents are still lobbying for tax breaks for the rich. I think the President should take a stand and stick to it. If not, he loses the trust he has. A lot of people have stood by
to support him with health care reform. If he does not hold fast on his promises, his supporters will lose faith.

……………..“I believe that we should be able to make sure that we don’t burden middle class families further,” he said. “Having said that, I’m also going to wait for the fiscal commission to provide me what their best recommendations are.”

The President should make up his mind and take a stand. NO passing of the buck. He’s the one that made the promise, not the fiscal commission. If he didn’t mean it, then he should admit it. The people that elected him invested in his presidency. We want a warranty on our votes.

No more double speak. This would be the sort of betrayal that has created such alienation and broken the faith of the American people.
